This episode examines the Shia understanding of Hadith al-Dar.

A list of chains for Hadith-ul-Dar that we collected in order to study them and their texts:

 

Ibn Ishaq (d. 150) from Abdulghafar bin Al-Qassim.

 

Ibn Jareer (d. 310) from Salama bin Al-Fadhl from Ibn Ishaq from Abdulghafar bin Al-Qasim from Al-Minhal bin Amr from Abdullah bin Al-Harith from Ibn Abbas from Ali.

 

Ibn Abi Hatim (d. 327) from Al-Hussain bin Eisa bin Maysara from Abdullah bin Abdulqudoos from Al-A’amash bin Amr (it should be from Al-A’amash from Al-Minhal bin Amr) from Abdullah bin Al-Harith from Ali.

 

Ibn Mardawayh (d. 410): Lost source.

 

Abu Nu’aym (d. 430) in Dala’il Al-Nubuwa from the path of Salama bin Al-Fadhl from Ibn Ishaq.

 

Al-Bayhaqi (d. 458) in Al-Sunan from the path of Yunus bin Bukair from Ibn Ishaq from someone from Abdullah bin Al-Harith bin Amr from Ibn Abbas from Ali.

 

Al-Bayhaqi in Dala’il Al-Nubuwa: same as above. Ahmad bin Abduljabar, the student of Yunus, said that this is from Abdulghafar bin Al-Qassim.

 

Al-Tha’alabi (d. 427) from Al-Husain bin Mohammad bin Al-Husain from Musa bin Mohammad bin Ali bin Abdullah from Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Shabeeb Al-Mu’ammir from Abbad bin Ya’qoub from Ali bin Hashim from Sabbah bin Yahya Al-Muzni from Zakariya bin Maysara from Abu Ishaq from Al-Baraa’.

 

Al-Tabari in Al-Tafseer: see previous.

 

Al-Tabari in Al-Tareekh: see previous.

 

Ibn Al-Atheer (d. 630): no source.

 

Abu Al-Fida’ (d. 732): no source.

 

Ibn Abi Al-Hadeed (d. 656): from Abu Ja’afar Al-Iskafi (d. 240).

 

Al-Halabi (d. 1044): no source.

 

Al-Tahawi in Sharh Ma’ani Al-Athar (d. 321): from the path of Salama from Ibn Ishaaq, and from Mohammad bin Abdullah Al-Asbahani from Abbad bin Ya’qoub from Abdullah bin Abdulqudoos from Al-A’amash from Al-Minhal bin Amr from Abbad bin Abdullah from Ali.

 

Al-Dhiya’ Al-Maqdisi (d. 643): From Musnad Ahmad from Aswad bin Amer from Shareek from Al-A’amash from Al-Minhal bin Amr from Abbad bin Abdullah Al-Asadi.

 

Sa’eed bin Mansour (d. 227): I could not find this narration in this book.

 

Imam Ahmad (d. 241): Aswad bin Amer from Shareek from Al-A’amash from Al-Minhal from Abbad bin Abdullah Al-Asadi from Ali.
